required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Human Ovarian Follicular Dynamics and Emergency Contraception
clinical_study.official_title: Human Ovarian Follicular Dynamics and Emergency Contraception

brief_summary.textblock: The researchers hypothesize that emergency contraception (EC) will initiate the changes associated with atresia or ovulatory failure at all stages of follicular development and that the image attributes associated with atresia will be similar regardless of the diameter of the dominant follicle when ovarian suppression is initiated. Second, changes associated with atresia may be observed, but ovulation of the dominant follicle is unimpeded.

detailed_description.textblock: This study is a single-center, randomized, open-label, double-controlled protocol to study the pattern of ovarian follicular growth and regression in two groups of women. The first group will use Plan B, which is a progesterone only OC containing 0.75 levonorgestrel. The second group of women will use the Yuzpe regimen, which uses 50 mg ethinyl estradiol/0.5 mg levonorgestrel pills at different stages of the menstrual follicular cycle.

reference.citation: Pierson RA, Archer DF, Moreau M, Shangold GA, Fisher AC, Creasy GW. Ortho Evra/Evra versus oral contraceptives: follicular development and ovulation in normal cycles and after an intentional dosing error. Fertil Steril. 2003 Jul;80(1):34-42.
Baerwald AR, Adams GP, Pierson RA. A new model for ovarian follicular development during the human menstrual cycle. Fertil Steril. 2003 Jul;80(1):116-22.
